children.subject: why are people in reddit saying CS188 are useless/boring?? I saw the first project and thought it is pretty fun implementing the algorithms..

I wouldn't say it is boring, but it is "useless" in that none of the things taught are actually used in modern AI systems. But you could say the same thing about most of the material in Berkeley upper div CS classes....

Well yeah you just answered the question about uselessness since the idea is that the class is fun but not necessarily useful for AI within industry, it's like a good high level overview but in the grand scheme of things you're better off taking cs 189/182/285 etc. for practical and generalizable AI knowledge. But at the same time, sometimes its good to just get your feet wet, which is why 188 is a good class to get a sense about whether you want to be in the field. Just my take on it.

What I know from others so far is that CS 188 is easy homework in normal semester but recently might increase the workload. CS161 is kind of heavy in project.CS160 is definitely possible according to my friend.

history.content:
Checkout the first pinned post @16543

Edit

-------------

I recommend Data C100 as I am taking it in Spring 2022 and while they do not have an async Discussion , however , one discussion was from 9:00 to 10:00 PM. Assuming that they offer same in summer it would be a good fit. Note they enforce pre-reqs so ensure you have them.

Hi, I am having internship this summer, however I really want to take another CS upper div because I want to have more space for other courses to prepare for research/grad. Any suggestions? I've taken CS170 and CS186. 

(Hope discussion can be asyn since I need to go in person for work)
history.subject: Any Summer Remote CS Upper Div possible taking with 8-hours/weekday Internship?
